summary: This is an email chain between a Special Agent and an Assistant United States Attorney regarding contacting Juan Alessi, a potential witness, to confirm his availability for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial in the fall of 2021. The email discusses coordinating through Alessi's attorney, John Reynolds.

persons.name: Juan Alessi
persons.context: He is the subject of the email chain; the prosecutors are seeking to confirm his availability to testify at the Ghislaine Maxwell trial in fall 2021.

persons.name: John Reynolds
persons.context: He is identified as Juan Alessi's attorney. He gave permission for prosecutors to contact Alessi directly to discuss trial availability.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: The recipient of the initial email, tasked with contacting Juan Alessi to confirm his trial schedule.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the initial email, coordinating with the FBI agent to schedule witness testimony for the Maxwell trial.

connections.description: John Reynolds is identified as the attorney representing Juan Alessi, as he gave permission for prosecutors to contact his client.
The prosecutor is tasking the FBI agent with contacting a witness to confirm availability for trial.
The prosecutor has communicated with Alessi's attorney, John Reynolds, to arrange contact with the witness.

events.title: Maxwell Trial Scheduling
events.description: Prosecutors are seeking to confirm Juan Alessi's availability to testify during the trial of Ghislaine Maxwell, scheduled for the fall of 2021.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Prosecutors were actively preparing witness testimony for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial as of May 2021.
Juan Alessi was a sought-after witness for the Maxwell trial, with his attorney facilitating contact.
The communication shows coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office and the FBI to schedule witness availability.
The trial was anticipated to occur between September and December 2021.
